channel.title: Help please
channel.description: Ok. It started when I was editing my source. I was changing up my yell command and also adding a "Say" command that sends a message to the server without any name. While I was doing this, I compiled and I have no errors in my compiler. I go into my server and for some reason every time someone does a command, it sends a message to all of that command, but with the first 3 letters cut out. So if I used the command ::home, it would do the command and send a message to everyone that says "e" and if I used a longer command, such as ::getpass namehere, it would do the command, and send a message to all saying "pass namehere" and same with every command.

item.title: Help please
item.dc:creator: @timmarus1 timmarus1
item.description:
@timmarus1 wrote:

No. I meant that I was writing a say command, and rewriting my yell command. I didn’t do anything other then that, I think

Read full topic

item.title: Help please
item.dc:creator: @timmarus1 timmarus1
item.description:
@timmarus1 wrote:

Ok. It started when I was editing my source. I was changing up my yell command and also adding a “Say” command that sends a message to the server without any name. While I was doing this, I compiled and I have no errors in my compiler. I go into my server and for some reason every time someone does a command, it sends a message to all of that command, but with the first 3 letters cut out. So if I used the command ::home, it would do the command and send a message to everyone that says “e” and if I used a longer command, such as ::getpass namehere, it would do the command, and send a message to all saying “pass namehere” and same with every command.

Read full topic
